title: Leading Population Health Improvement
text:
Since January 2021, I have served as the state public health officer and director of the California Department of Public Health. From January 2011 to December 2020, I was the health officer of the City and County of San Francisco and director of the Population Health Division at the San Francisco Department of Public Health.
The lean DNA codes for the following:

Respect for people (staff, community, client, patient)
Continuous improvement (incremental and breakthrough)
Scientific thinking, problem solving, and innovation
Elimination of waste and undesired variability
Being agile, adaptive, and responsive to meet challenges

Here are some citations [1–3].








Some caption







Figure 1 further explores the impact of temperature on ozone level.


Code
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(airquality, aes(Temp, Ozone)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "loess"
)





Figure 1: Temperature and ozone level.









Julia version 1.8.0 at location /Applications/Julia-1.8.app/Contents/Resources/julia/bin will be used.


Loading setup script for JuliaCall...


Finish loading setup script for JuliaCall.


Plot function pair (x(u), y(u)). See Figure 2 for an example.


Code
using Plots

plot(sin, 
     x->sin(2x), 
     0, 
     2π, 
     leg=false, 
     fill=(0,:lavender))





Figure 2: Parametric Plots




By default Julia cells will automatically print the value of their last statement (as with the example above where the call to plot() resulted in plot output). If you want to display multiple plots (or other types of output) from a single cell you should call the display() function explicitly. For example, here we output two plots side-by-side with sub-captions:


Code
using Plots

display(plot(sin, x -> sin(2x), 0, 2))
display(plot(x -> sin(4x), y -> sin(5y), 0, 2))








(a) Plot 2







(b) Plot 1




Figure 3: Multiple Plots







1. Aragón T, Reiter R, Katcher B. San francisco burden of disease & injury study: Mortality analysis 1990-1995 [Internet]. San Francisco Department of Public Health; 1998. Available from: http://bit.ly/SFDPH1998-BODI-Report


2. Aragón TJ, Ulrich S, Fernyak S, Rutherford GW. Risks of serious complications and death from smallpox vaccination: A systematic review of the united states experience, 1963-1968. BMC public health. 2003 Aug;3:26. 


3. Aragón TJ, Fernyak SE. The risks and benefits of pre-event smallpox vaccination: Where you stand depends on where you sit. Annals of emergency medicine. 2003 Nov;42:681–4.
